meanings.definition: A stuffy or musty atmosphere in a room.
meanings.sent1: The old attic had a frowst that made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: After closing all the windows, the bedroom quickly filled with frowst.
meanings.sent3: The frowst in the basement was so thick, it felt like walking through a cloud.
meanings.sent4: The frowst in the library clung to the books like a damp cloak.
meanings.sent5: The frowst in the abandoned house smelled like forgotten memories.

meanings.definition: To make a room stuffy or musty.
meanings.sent1: Leaving wet clothes on the floor can frowst up a room quickly.
meanings.sent2: If you don't open the windows, you will frowst the entire house.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally frowsted up the bathroom by taking a long, hot shower.
meanings.sent4: The closed curtains frowsted the living room with a stale air.
meanings.sent5: The lack of ventilation can easily frowst a small space.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of discomfort or unease.
meanings.sent1: He began to frowst as the meeting dragged on without any progress.
meanings.sent2: The uncertainty of the situation made her frowst with anxiety.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can frowst a person's mind.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the dark alley frowsted him with fear.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the test results made her frowst with nervousness.
